title: What causes opioid addiction, and why is it so tough to combat? - Mike Davis

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the chemical compound isolated from opium for medical use in the 19th century?
What is the primary reason why people who are addicted to opioids continue to use the drugs?

options.label: A
options.text: To experience the sense of euphoria

options.label: B
options.text: To avoid being sick due to withdrawal symptoms

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the medication that binds to opioid receptors but doesn't activate them, used to reverse an overdose?
According to the transcript, what is one of the obstacles to accessing treatment for opioid addiction?

options.label: B
options.text: The requirement of complete detoxification from opioids before beginning treatment

options.label: C
options.text: The lack of trained doctors to prescribe opioid maintenance drugs

multiple-choice.question: What is the phone number of the helpline operated by the Department of Health and Human Services for those struggling with opioid use in the United States?

title: Contractions! | English grammar practice

multiple-choice.question: What is the main topic of the speaker's thoughts in the transcript?
Which of the following is an example of a contraction used in the transcript?
What is the difference between "where is" and "where's" in the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: "Where is" is used for plural nouns, while "where's" is used for singular nouns.

options.label: B
options.text: "Where is" is used for formal writing, while "where's" is used for informal writing.

options.label: C
options.text: "Where is" is a full phrase, while "where's" is a contraction.

options.label: D
options.text: "Where is" is used for questions, while "where's" is used for statements.

options.label: C

title: Punctuation explained (by Punctuation!)

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of a period in punctuation?

options.label: B
options.text: To separate items in a list

options.label: C
options.text: To mark the end of a complete thought

multiple-choice.question: Which punctuation mark is used to express strong feelings?

multiple-choice.question: Which punctuation mark is used to ask a question?

options.text: To demonstrate the use of a period

options.label: B
options.text: To show the use of a comma in listing items

title: What is society? | US society for children

multiple-choice.question: What is a society?

options.label: A
options.text: A small group of people who live in the same neighborhood

options.label: B
options.text: A large group of people who share the same laws, rights, and resources

options.label: C
options.text: A group of people who only speak the same language

options.label: D
options.text: A group of people who only have the same job

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of a society that is not limited by geographical location?
What do members of a society have in common?
Can members of a society live far away from one another?

options.label: A
options.text: No, they must live in the same neighborhood

options.label: B
options.text: Yes, they can live far away from one another

options.label: C
options.text: Only if they have the same job

options.label: D
options.text: Only if they speak the same language

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of a society that is formed based on a shared interest or activity?

options.label: A
options.text: A group of people who live in the same city

options.label: B
options.text: A group of doctors who work at the same hospital

options.label: D
options.text: A group of people who only speak the same language

title: Which is better: Soap or hand sanitizer? - Alex Rosenthal and Pall Thordarson

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary way that the coronavirus that causes COVID-19 is structured?

options.label: A
options.text: A geometric protein structure called a capsid

options.label: B
options.text: A lipid bilayer with pin-shaped molecules

options.label: C
options.text: A shell with a single layer of molecules

options.label: D
options.text: A complex structure with multiple layers of molecules

multiple-choice.question: How do soap molecules (amphiphiles) work to break down the coronavirus's shell?

options.label: A
options.text: They compete with the lipids for space and break up the regularity of the membrane

options.label: B
options.text: They form a strong bond with the lipids and hold the shell together

options.label: C
options.text: They have no effect on the shell and only clean the surface

options.label: D
options.text: They only work on certain types of viruses

multiple-choice.question: What is the recommended amount of time to wash your hands with soap and water to effectively destroy the coronavirus?
Why is hand sanitizer recommended as a secondary option to soap and water?

options.label: A
options.text: It is more effective at killing the virus

options.label: B
options.text: It is easier to use on the go

options.label: C
options.text: It is less expensive than soap and water

options.label: D
options.text: It has a stronger scent than soap and water

multiple-choice.question: What is a limitation of using soap and water to destroy rhinoviruses that cause the common cold?

options.label: A
options.text: Soap and water are too harsh on the skin

options.label: B
options.text: Soap and water are not effective against rhinoviruses

options.label: C
options.text: Soap and water take longer to be effective against rhinoviruses

options.label: D
options.text: Soap and water are too expensive

title: This sea creature breathes through its butt - Cella Wright

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of a sea cucumber's respiratory tree?
What is the term for the gel-like tissue that allows sea cucumbers to defend themselves and reproduce asexually?
What is the process by which sea cucumbers release their internal organs as a defense mechanism?
What percentage of animal biomass do sea cucumbers comprise on the deep sea floor?
What is the result of sea cucumbers breaking down detritus and recycling nutrients on the seafloor?

options.label: C
options.text: The creation of conditions for sea grass beds and shellfish to thrive

title: Can you trust your eyes?

multiple-choice.question: What is the main idea behind the Munker-White illusion?

options.label: A
options.text: That our brains can see colors more accurately than we think.

options.label: B
options.text: That our brains judge color and brightness in context.

options.label: C
options.text: That our eyes can see absolute colors and physical properties.

options.label: D
options.text: That our perception of the world is not linked to our vision.

multiple-choice.question: Why do our brains compensate by interpreting the tile as being lighter than it appears in the tile illusion?

options.label: A
options.text: Because our brains know that shadows make objects look lighter.

options.label: B
options.text: Because our brains know that shadows make objects look darker.

options.label: C
options.text: Because our brains are trying to trick us into seeing something that's not there.

options.label: D
options.text: Because our brains are not able to interpret colors correctly.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of our senses, including our eyes?

options.label: A
options.text: To provide us with an absolute color or physical property of our external reality.

options.label: B
options.text: To interpret what we see as efficiently as possible in order to interact with the environment most appropriately.

options.label: C
options.text: To trick us into seeing things that are not there.

options.label: D
options.text: To make us question our perception of the world.

multiple-choice.question: What happens when the background gradient is removed from the middle bar in the gradient illusion?

options.label: A
options.text: The bar appears to be a different color.

options.label: B
options.text: The bar appears to be the same color as before.

multiple-choice.question: What can be concluded about our perception based on the illusions presented?

options.label: C
options.text: That our perception is not linked to our vision.

options.label: D
options.text: That our perception is always accurate.
